name: Dop1R2
otheraliases: Dmel_CG18741, CG18741, CG7569, D1R2, D2R, DAMB, DDR2, DOPR2, DOPR99B, DR2, Damb, Dar2, DmDOP2, Dmel\CG18741, Dop1r2, DopD1, DopR, DopR2, DopR99B, DopRII, K13sc, damb, dopr2
otherdesignations: dopamine 1-like receptor 2|CG18741-PA|CG18741-PB|CG18741-PC|DAMB DA receptor|D[|Dop1R2-PA|Dop1R2-PB|Dop1R2-PC|K13sc|damb|dopamine receptor 2|dopamine receptor in mushroom bodies|dopamine receptor in mushroom body|dopamine-2 receptor
summary: Enables dopamine neurotransmitter receptor activity, coupled via Gs and tyramine receptor activity. Involved in several processes, including adenylate cyclase-activating dopamine receptor signaling pathway; regulation of presynaptic cytosolic calcium ion concentration; and response to odorant. Predicted to be located in membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. Is expressed in adult mushroom body alpha-lobe; adult mushroom body beta-lobe; lobe system of mushroom body; mushroom body; and mushroom body spur. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in Alzheimer's disease; heroin dependence; and hypertension. Orthologous to human ADRA1A (adrenoceptor alpha 1A); ADRA1B (adrenoceptor alpha 1B); and ADRA1D (adrenoceptor alpha 1D). [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Jul 2025]
